Description:
Aconitine, an alkaloid in Aconite, is a very effective sedative. However, it has been used to poison arrows and poses a great risk. Aconitine is listed as the second strongest poison of any plant found in Europe.



Only 2-10 grams of the Aconite bulb is considered a deadly dosage and even skin contact is already dangerous. Other sedatives offer more safety. However, Aconite is commonly used in Homeopathy which does not pose any risk at all.



Aconite, as a perennial with striking blue flowers, makes an attractive garden plant.

Description:
False Unicorn is known for its tonic properties.

It soothes the intestinal membranes and is good for all digestive problems.

The roots are also listed as a tonic for the kidneys, the prostate and the uterus.

They are used for Uterine infections, Endometriosis, Menstrual problems, Morning sickness, to prevent Miscarriage and help to normalize the release of hormones by the ovaries. (Richters)

Description:
Nutmeg, in small amounts, relieves gas and calms the nerves.



Warning: In large amounts it may cause hallucinations, rapid heartbeat, vomiting it will lead to narcotic poisoning. Watch for dry lips as a first sign of trouble. While small amounts may be used for a calming effect and is normally well tolerated, larger amounts act as a depressant. Eating one whole nutmeg may cause serious side-effects, including double vision and delirium. 

Death may result from eating no more than 2 nutmegs.
Action: Aromatic, carminative, digestive, depressant, hallucinogenic, stimulant, stomachic.
Dosage: A third of a teaspoon with a tall glass of water; 2 to 3 times daily.
References: No major reference available for this plant.

Description:
Clinical studies support the use of Milk Thistle. Also approved by the Commission E, Milk Thistle may be the first choice treating a sick liver. Silymarin, the active ingredient, increases the protein synthesis in the liver, speeding recovery from hepatitis, cirrhosis, toxic liver damage, etc.

It has been shown to protect, and help in recovery, victims of Amanita Poisoning. Silymarin protects the attacked membrane and prevents the Amanita poison Phalloidine from binding with receptors in the membrane.
Dosage:
1 teaspoon of ground seeds with 1 glass of water; 3 to 9 times daily.

Capsules and tincture: As directed.
References:
The German Commission E confirmed usefulness of Milk Thistle for:

Cirrhosis, liver problems, hepatitis, toxic liver damage, dyspepsia.
